name: src/common/activate-event.js
ActivateEvent
description: Custom event emitted when an item is activated in a menu.

name: src/common/change-event.js
ChangeEvent
description: Custom event emitted when the selected option of a {@link ListBox} or a {@link TabSet} has changed.

params.name: index
params.description: The index of the newly selected option

unknown.tagValue: {number} the index of the newly selected item (-1 for none)

return.description: the index of the newly selected item (-1 for none)

name: src/common/toggle-event.js
ToggleEvent
description: Custom event emitted when an expandable section opens or closes.

params.name: open
params.description: whether the current section is expanded

unknown.tagValue: {Boolean} whether the current section is expanded

return.description: whether the current section is expanded

name: src/index.js
src/listbox/index.js
content:
export * from './listbox.js';
export * from './listbox-option.js';

name: src/listbox/listbox-option.js
ListBoxOption
description: An option to be nested within a {@link ListBox} element

unknown.tagValue: {boolean} whether the option is currently selected or not

return.description: whether the option is currently selected or not

unknown.tagValue: {string} The value related to the option

return.description: The value related to the option

name: value
description: Reflects on ``value`` attribute

name: src/listbox/listbox.js
ListBox
description:
Implements the ListBox pattern for single select ListBox where the focus follows the selection.

Keyboard interaction is handled for <kbd>Up Arrow</kbd>, <kbd>Down Arrow</kbd>, <kbd>Home</kbd> and <kbd>End</kbd>. In the same way if an option is clicked, then it becomes selected
examples: Some custom template Other option selected by default

unknown.tagValue: {number} - The current number of available options

return.description: The current number of available options

unknown.tagValue: {number} The index of the currently selected option, -1 if none is selected

return.description: The index of the currently selected option, -1 if none is selected

name: selectedIndex
description: Reflects on ``aria-activedescendant`` attribute

params.name: index
params.description: The index of the new option element to select

name: src/tabs/index.js
src/tabs/tab-panel.js
TabPanel
description:
A tab panel to be nested inside a {@link TabSet} element. The order is important:
the nth tab will match the nth {@link Tab}

unknown.tagValue: {boolean} Whether the panel is currently active

return.description: Whether the panel is currently active

name: src/tabs/tab-set.js
TabSet
description:
Implements the Tabs pattern

Keyboard interaction is handled for <kbd>Left Arrow</kbd>, <kbd>Right Arrow</kbd>, <kbd>Home</kbd>, <kbd>End</kbd>, <kbd>Space</kbd> and <kbd>Enter</kbd>

Click on a tab is also handled

Note, by default the tab is activated on user's demand ie it does not follow the focus. If you wish to automatically select the tab on focus,
add the ``follow-focus`` attribute
examples:
some sophisticated template

Some content very interesting The tab panel can come directly after its related tab

selected by default third tab Or later, just the index matters Content for the third panel

unknown.tagValue: {boolean} Configure whether the tab activation should follow the focus

return.description: Configure whether the tab activation should follow the focus

unknown.tagValue: {number} The number of tabs in the set

return.description: The number of tabs in the set

unknown.tagValue: {number} the index of the currently selected tab

return.description: the index of the currently selected tab

name: selectedIndex
description: Reflects on ``selected-tab-index`` attribute

name: src/tabs/tab.js
Tab
description:
A tab to be nested inside a {@link TabSet} element. The order is important:
the nth tab will match the nth {@link TabPanel}

unknown.tagValue: {boolean} Whether the tab is currently active or not

return.description: Whether the tab is currently active or not

content:
[![CircleCI](https://badgen.net/circleci/github/Citykleta/ui-kit)](https://circleci.com/gh/Citykleta/ui-kit)

# Citykleta UI-Kit

Common widgets built with native **web components** (no extra lib or framework) and with **accessibility** in mind. Based on the 
[wai-aria authoring recommendations](https://www.w3.org/TR/wai-aria-practices/#combobox)

## Usage

### Installation

``npm install --save @citykleta/ui-kit``

### Getting Started

You'll need first to register the component with namespace of your choice. Then simply add the tags in your markup 

```html
<ui-listbox>
    <ui-listbox-option selected>option 1</ui-listbox-option>
    <ui-listbox-option>option 2</ui-listbox-option>
    <ui-listbox-option>option 3</ui-listbox-option>
    <ui-listbox-option>option 4</ui-listbox-option>
</ui-listbox>

<script type="module" async>
import {ListBox, ListBoxOption} from 'path/to/lib';
customElements.define('ui-listbox',ListBox);
customElements.define('ui-listbox-option',ListBoxOption);
</script>
```

### With framework X

All these web components can be configured and updated with attributes which make it very easy to integrate with any vue engine (such [React]() for example)

```javascript

```
name: ./README.md

content:
{
  "name": "@citykleta/ui-kit",
  "version": "0.2.0",
  "description": "web components for common widgets used across citykleta organization",
  "main": "./dist/index",
  "module": "./dist/citykleta-ui-kit.js",
  "scripts": {
    "serve": "http-serve -p 3002",
    "build": "rollup -c ./rollup/build.js && npm run build:docs",
    "build:test": "rollup -c ./rollup/test.js",
    "build:docs": "rm -rf docs && esdoc",
    "test:ci": "http-serve -s -p 3002 & (npm run test | tap-set-exit)",
    "test": "node ./test/run-test.js",
    "dev": "npm run serve & npm run build:test -- -w"
  },
  "files": [
    "dist"
  ],
  "repository": {
    "type": "git",
    "url": "git+https://github.com/Citykleta/ui-kit.git"
  },
  "keywords": [
    "ui",
    "ux",
    "components",
    "web-components",
    "webcomponents",
    "aria",
    "ally",
    "wai-aria",
    "widgets"
  ],
  "author": "Laurent RENARD",
  "license": "MIT",
  "bugs": {
    "url": "https://github.com/Citykleta/ui-kit/issues"
  },
  "homepage": "https://github.com/Citykleta/ui-kit#readme",
  "devDependencies": {
    "esdoc": "^1.1.0",
    "esdoc-standard-plugin": "^1.0.0",
    "esm": "^3.2.25",
    "http-serve": "^1.0.1",
    "puppeteer": "^1.20.0",
    "rollup": "^1.22.0",
    "rollup-plugin-node-resolve": "^5.2.0",
    "tap-set-exit": "^1.1.1",
    "zora": "^3.0.3"
  },
  "dependencies": {
    "@lorenzofox3/for-await": "^0.2.0"
  }
}
